result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Court ordered STANDARD CONDITIONS OF PROBATION.
- Provide DNA sample.

* October 6, 2022/Judge David Swanson: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,805.95 payable to victim CKG to be paid during the term of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.*

- TBD at Restitution hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamron Lashawn Jackson

records.addlTxt:
CLARIFICATION TO 8/23/22 SENTENCING:
The probation terms are for both counts. The Condition Time is for count 1.

Defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Kamron Lashawn Jackson.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a restitution hearing. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,805.95 payable to victim CKG to be paid during the term of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Judgment of conviction to be amended to reflect restitution information.

Defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Kamron Lashawn Jackson.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO ALL COUNTS:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 91 days time served. 
*
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE with COUNT 1.
*
The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 10 DAYS condition time, STRAIGHT TIME.
- Court ordered STANDARD CONDITIONS OF PROBATION.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Regular participation in High School, HSED or GED program until completed.
 

*Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes high school. 

Court set restitution hearing date. Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Addendum to plea and questionnaire, received and filed

CH608/10:17 Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson not in court, in custody in a Covid pod.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has not satisfied victim notification.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court by telephone, defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson not in court, in custody under Covid restriction.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.   

*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Bail/bond hearing. Defendant does not have counsel appointed yet. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Lori Kuehn, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning 9-1-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case remains set for Preliminary Hearing on June 3, 2022 at 1:30 PM.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

ADDRESS INFO for Kamron Lashawn Jackson
Current: 2014 W KEEFE AVE, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 05-26-2022)
Prior: 3167 North Palmer Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Kamron Lashawn Jackson in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kamron Lashawn Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. AS TO COUNT 3;  On Court's own motion, Court orders COUNT 3 DISMISSED FOR INCORRECT DATE IN PROBABLE CAUSE SECTION.  COUNT 3 dismissed without prejudice. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENSE REQUEST TO BE HEARD ON BAIL BEFORE THE TRIAL COURT.   Case is adjourned to Br. 15 FOR BR. 28. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
